name: Data Leak – Containment
description:
# 🛡️ Data Leak – Containment

---

## 🎯 Usage

Quickly execute containment measures to:

* **Contain** the leak
* **Freeze** the situation
* **Regain control**

---

## ⚙️ Prerequisites before starting

* ✅ *Qualification* sheet completed and conclusions validated (scope, probable cause, urgency)
* 🔐 Administration access available (network / MTA / proxy / EDR / storage)

---

## 📌 Objectives

### ✅ Technically contain the attack’s propagation

1. Block the employee’s suspicious access
2. Block and monitor exfiltration traffic
3. Secure compromised accounts and systems

### ✅ Limit data exposure

4. Limit data exposure

### ✅ Preserve traces

5. Preserve traces

### ✅ Maintain operational continuity

6. Maintain operational continuity

### ✅ Communicate on the incident

7. Communicate internally about the data leak
8. Communicate publicly about the data leak

---

## 📄 Useful resources

* Official *Containment* & *Qualification* sheets InterCERT-FR

👉 [Data Leak – Containment (INTERCERT-FR)](https://www.intercert-france.fr/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/fichereflexe-fuitededonnees-endiguement.pdf)

tasks.title: Containment closure & transition to remediation
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Confirm stabilization and plan remediation + post-incident monitoring.

### 📌 Actions

* Verify termination of exfiltration traffic
* List and prioritize remediations (patching, hardening, IAM, data cleanup, awareness)
* Schedule **enhanced monitoring** for X days (SIEM, EDR, MTA, dark web)

### ✅ Deliverables

End-of-containment report + remediation backlog

tasks.title: Initial Prioritization & Use Cases
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

The measures in this reflex sheet are grouped by themes, not by priority. Quickly select the containment path based on the **scenario** (external/internal/human error) and **urgency**. (see reflex sheet page 4)

### 📌 Actions

* Determine the attack scenario type to prioritize (external/internal/human error)

### ✅ Deliverables

* Selected scenario, prioritized measures (document choices in the **activities** of this task)

tasks.title: Measure 1 – Block the employee’s suspicious access
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

**Block** all access of the impacted employee.
*NOTE: This measure applies if the data leak was caused by an internal or external employee.*

### 📌 Actions

* Notify HR and legal teams (legal if the leak appears malicious)
* Block the employee’s access

  * Physical and logical
  * Applications and sensitive data
  * Disable all accounts associated with the employee
* Retrieve the employee’s equipment if possible

### ✅ Deliverables

* List of blocks + HR/manager communications
* Log the actions performed in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 3 – Secure compromised accounts & systems
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

**Remove attacker access** and stabilize hosts.

### 📌 Actions

* Identify compromised accounts and systems
  → Accounts: reset, **revoke sessions**, enforce MFA, disable if at risk
  → Hosts: EDR containment, lock remote access
  → Secrets: rotate API keys/certificates
  → Mail/Tenant: mailbox rules, *app consent*, abnormal roles
* Renew passwords for compromised accounts and systems (tokens, sessions, SSH)
* Strengthen account and system security (MFA, biometrics, …)

### ✅ Deliverables

* Inventory of secured accounts/hosts + evidence added to the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 4 – Limit data exposure
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

**Restrict/remove** access to sensitive data and monitor its **dissemination**.

### 📌 Actions

* Data exposed outside the organization

  * If data is available on a public site, request the owner to delete or restrict access to the disclosed data and keep a record of the request
  * Have the employee or third party sign a waiver confirming deletion of all exfiltrated data from personal devices, along with a non-disclosure agreement (NDA)
* Data exposed within the organization’s internal zone

  * Cut access to the data. Note: cut access to the service, not power off the machine (it must remain on for investigations)
* Monitor disclosed documents or information

  * Monitor disclosed documents and information using internal tools, external attack surface management, and corporate threat intelligence (ASM, TOR, …)

### ✅ Deliverables

* Restriction log added to the **activities** of this task
* Monitoring sources activated

tasks.title: Measure 6 – Maintain operational continuity
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Limit business impact while maintaining containment.

### 📌 Actions

* Stabilize critical operations
* Temporary measures: CDN/WAF, throttling, failover, *rate-limiting*
* Ensure service continuity (follow BCP if available)
* Adjust internal SLAs; prioritize essential services
* Synchronize with Helpdesk (FAQ, standard responses)

### ✅ Deliverables

* Business continuity decisions + accepted risks
* List of measures and decisions documented in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 7/8 – Communication & Compliance
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Align internal/external messaging and comply with **regulatory deadlines**.

### 📌 Actions

* Internal: guidelines (do not click/forward, how to report)
* Regulatory: elements for **CNIL/authorities/insurer** (data, volumes, deadlines, measures)
* External: *holding statement*, Q\&A, media plan if needed

### ✅ Deliverables

* Validated communication package
* Communication messages documented in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 5 – Preserve traces
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Preserve evidence for investigation and compliance.

### 📌 Actions

* Preserve traces in equipment logs
  → Logs: SIEM, MTA, proxy, WAF, EDR, systems, applications
  → Artifacts: emails (.eml/.msg), URLs, attachments, hashes
* Preserve traces in authentication logs (AD, SIEM)
* Collect files related to the data leak
* Export traces to an offline disk

### ✅ Deliverables

* Timestamped evidence folder added to the case
* Actions logged in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 2 – Block and monitor exfiltration traffic
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

**Block** any suspicious outbound channel.

### 📌 Actions

* Identify suspicious traffic
* Block inbound and outbound traffic
  → Proxy/Firewall/WAF: block FQDN/IP/URLs/ASN; switch to *log-only* if needed for refinement
  → MTA/Email: *transport rules*, quarantine, retro-hunting
  → EDR: network isolation of hosts
  → Cloud/SaaS: disable public shares, revoke links
* Implement enhanced monitoring (SIEM, DLP, GPO, …)
* Ensure sensitive data is protected (encryption)

### ✅ Deliverables

* List of blocks + logs confirming effectiveness
* Log the actions performed in the **activities** of this task
